remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。You must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一对象，直到调用。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized.

summary.span: 获取枚举数当前位置的元素。

span.span: Gets the element at the current position of the enumerator.

value.span: 中位于该枚举数当前位置的元素。

span.span: The element in the at the current position of the enumerator.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 未定义任何以下情况下： is undefined under any of the following conditions: - 枚举数位于集合中的第一个元素之前。The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection. 这种情况下，创建一个枚举器或调用方法。That happens after an enumerator is created or after the method is called. 必须在调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素属性。The method must be called to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of the property. - 上次调用返回`false`时，指示集合的末尾，枚举数位于集合中的最后一个元素之后。The last call to returned `false`, which indicates the end of the collection and that the enumerator is positioned after the last element of the collection. - 枚举器无效，由于在集合中，如添加、 修改或删除元素所做的更改。The enumerator is invalidated due to changes made in the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements. 不会移动位置的枚举器，并对连续调用直到返回同一对象或调用。 does not move the position of the enumerator, and consecutive calls to return the same object until either or is called.

summary.span: 使枚举数前进到 的下一个元素。

span.span: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the .

returns.span: 如果枚举数已成功地推进到下一个元素，则为 ；如果枚举数传递到集合的末尾，则为 。

span.span: if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 创建一个枚举器后，枚举数位于集合中，并在首次调用中的第一个元素之前方法将枚举器推进到集合的第一个元素。After an enumerator is created, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection, and the first call to the method advances the enumerator to the first element of the collection. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an .

exception.span: 集合在枚举器创建后被修改。

span.span: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 未定义任何以下情况下： is undefined under any of the following conditions: - 枚举数位于集合中的第一个元素之前。The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection. 这种情况下，创建一个枚举器或调用方法。That happens after an enumerator is created or after the method is called. 必须在调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素属性。The method must be called to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of the property. - 上次调用返回`false`时，指示集合的末尾，枚举数位于集合中的最后一个元素之后。The last call to returned `false`, which indicates the end of the collection and that the enumerator is positioned after the last element of the collection. - 枚举器无效，由于在集合中，如添加、 修改或删除元素所做的更改。The enumerator is invalidated due to changes made in the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements. 不会移动位置的枚举器，并对连续调用直到返回同一对象或调用。 does not move the position of the enumerator, and consecutive calls to return the same object until either or is called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在调用方法时，必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素属性。After calling the method, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of the property. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an .
